featured.text: Scientists already knew earlier that wind and splashes of rainwater can move bacteria and other germs from leaf to leaf.
The pollutants run with rainwater into rivers and streams, which 36 the poisons into the ocean.
They can drink seawater when it mixes with rainwater.

definition.zh_def: 雨水，指降落到地面的水，通常來自降雨。
definition.en_def: Water that falls to the ground as precipitation, typically from rain.
definition.example: The garden benefits from collecting rainwater for irrigation.
